website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option from a reputable brand equipped with a variety of convenient features.
pros: Has self-adjusting tension to prevent bunching or catching
Dials and knobs are easy to access, making minor adjustments between projects fairly simple
Capable of extra high-speed sewing, making it ideal for high-volume hobbyists
cons: Some reports of threading mechanism difficulties, which takes some navigation to overcome

customer_reviews.title: Received a used machine. Twice!
customer_reviews.text: First time the item had usage marks and small scratches so I immediately asked to replace it hoping that the second time it will be new. I was wrong.. second machine arrived with even more scratches and a few broken plastic parts shaking inside. Another red light was the different papers that came with both items. One had the manual and the other didn't. Very suspicious. Needless to say I will not opt for a third. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Gil Yaron

customer_reviews.title: Least user friendly machine I've every used
customer_reviews.text: I've worked in multiple studios with many different sergers and have never had a problem threading and troubleshooting them. From everything I can tell I thread this machine right, but can only get it to do one or two different stitches. The booklet that is included has a few mistakes that make learning the machine even more confusing. In my opinion, this machine sacrifices efficiency for versatility, which means that instead of being able to do one or two things well, it does many thing very poorly (or not at all).
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I am an experienced seamstress and this machine is not a good purchase for novice or experienced sewers
customer_reviews.text: This machine is sooooooo difficult to thread!! The instructions are not clear!! Lower looper threading is nearly impossible to even get to because of the design of the machine! By the time I had time to actually to sit down to try and figure it all out the return time had lapsed! I am an experienced seamstress and this machine is not a good purchase for novice or experienced sewers!!! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Janousek

customer_reviews.title: Get a Brother 1034D Instead!
customer_reviews.text: I was initially so impressed by this machine because of its capabilities. However, it hasn’t even been a year since I’ve had it and I’ve already had to have it serviced twice and it currently needs repair again. It’s so delicate and easily unaligns. The timing was off three seperate times which is like a $150 repair. That’s unacceptable for a brand new machine. I say buy the Brother 1034D instead. This was a waste of money. Even the manufacturer doesn’t even have much information on this model so it’s really frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Travis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Serger/Coverstitch machine!
customer_reviews.text: This machine sews like a dream! I purchased it for the coverstitch capability and boy am I glad I did. It sews a wonderful coverstitch and is so much quieter than my Singer Stylist II serger. It almost makes me want to use it as a serger as well--I just don't want to change the settings each time. It was easy to thread and the manual was easy to understand. Since it also sews a chain stitch, it's capable of sewing a single line of stitching, an overlock stitch, as well as a 2 or 3 coverstitch! If I hadn't already purchased the Stylist II, I would buy another one to use as my serger! An all around great machine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Has a learning curve but works great
customer_reviews.text: Expect to spend some time learning to thread this machine. Once you have done it a few times it become easier, but it can be frustrating in the beginning. Once properly thread it sews beautifully. Its a little loud but most sergers are, its not so loud that its a problem though. Overall I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Field

customer_reviews.title: I would love it from all I see in the videos
customer_reviews.text: I have spent hours, yes hours about 6 in all, trying to thread this machine. I have watched You-tube videos, but have not been able to find one that shows you how to thread. The videos show you thing that the surger will do, but not actually how to thread it. I'm sure if I could learn how to thread the machine, I would love it from all I see in the videos.
customer_reviews.author: April Ammons

customer_reviews.title: Good Serger
customer_reviews.text: This machine replaced a very good machine I wore out after 25 years. It works very well but the directions are neither written, illustrated nor organized well, in my opinion. I checked the internet repeatedly and still had to figure out much on my own. I think a beginner would need some hands on help to use this machine. Extra lighting close to the machine helps due to the complexity of the inner working parts.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: A very nice machine with many features
customer_reviews.text: I really like this machine, though I’m still learning how to use it. I am a beginner as far as sergers go, so am starting at level 1. This machine has a lot of features and options at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Croll

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it, but takes time to learn
customer_reviews.text: I love my machine now that I've practiced on it and have learned how to thread, etc. Because it does both coverstitch and serging, it took time to understand how to thread both. I still have to go to the manual and some YT videos helped a little on the side. But the finished stitching is great. So glad I invested in this machine
customer_reviews.author: DigiMom

customer_reviews.title: OK for a beginning serger sewer.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in the quality of this machine for a singer, I have 5 singer sewing machines and this one is the cheapest one made. The parts seem cheap and plastic, I do a lot of sewing and this machine is slow and loud when sewing. For a machine called “professional “ it is disappointing. This is an OK starter serger for beginners, but I believe experienced sewers will be disappointed. I kept it instead of returning it because I didn’t have time to have my White 2000 repaired at the time.
customer_reviews.author: CAS

customer_reviews.title: Time is the key with this machine
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this machine. It was absolutely worth the price I paid but as someone who had never used a serger before I can say I had to spend some time learning. I found a great reference on YouTube that helped me incredibly. I watched his videos several times and then I got it. You will definitely need to print out the manual and the work book.
customer_reviews.author: Andramida

customer_reviews.title: This is an advanced machine.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today. At first I was a bit intimidated by the complexity. But after reading the manual and attaching my thread to the pre-threads I was completing excellant three needle coverstitch. WOW. I bought it for coverstitch use only. I have an elna serger but it is nice to have a backup. I had been looking at this machine for months but was temporarily distracted by the Janome 2000cpx. For the money this is a well built machine.
customer_reviews.author: BYUBOY

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied With My Singer 14T968DC Professional 5-Thread Serger
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the Singer 14T968DC Professional 5-Thread serger. It is definitely much easier to thread than my old serger (another brand) and that was one of the most important features I was looking for. Have only used the serger for about a month. No complaints. The manual is excellent and is easy for me to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great looking serger, but I ended up sending it back, the instruction are to to poor. You have to find tour way to find out how it works. I tryied youtube but there are not much good videos there that help, you will have to invest to much time that I don't to figure this out or pay someone to help you learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ing.

customer_reviews.title: Fun So Far
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Fun to use ... After you learn it. Kind of complicated at first, but after watching some YouTube videos on this machine it becomes MUCH less intimidating. Singer should create some VIDEO tutorials to help the customer better... Much better than the instruction manual alone. Loved the fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: bizbossgirl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome serger. For the price you get the performance of a much more expensive machine. This is the second serger I have owned. The instructions and controls are complicated to understand so I bought a label machine and marked all the controls with it. It helped a lot while I was learning to use it with the instructions. Once you learn how to use this machine you will really enjoy it as it runs well and does a very nice job.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Young

customer_reviews.title: Yusssss!
customer_reviews.text: I am anot intermediate sewer, and after the 6 hours it took me to get it threaded, I FINALLY got it right! Trick is... READ THE INSTRUCTIONS! I am impressed by the machine altogether. I can coverstitch, and there is such a huge variety of stitches this beast can make! Overall, WORTH. EVERY. PENNY.
customer_reviews.author: LookHowCreative

customer_reviews.title: This machine ROCKS!!!!!! Get one and you will love.
customer_reviews.text: I have never in my 47 years seen a serger. 2 years ago I took up sewing as a hobby and the other day came across this serger and decided I was gonna get it. It came today and within an hour I was sewing up a storm. The reviews I saw said if you are a beginner this is not the one for you to start out with, well let me tell you it is the one I started off with and I love it. It sews so smooth and nice. I am glad I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Professional Machine
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a coverstitch machine for knits. Not only was this affordable, it also sews professional stitches. I'm a sewing professional & this machine was not easy to thread. The manuals aren't too clear. I used YouTube tutorials from people who have the machine for threading.
customer_reviews.author: Oohlala

customer_reviews.title: A serger for the experienced sewer.
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to sergers, this one is not for you. I’ve been sewing almost all my life, and serging for about 30 years. Even so, this serger was intimidating upon unboxing. I’ve slowly been working my way through the work book (included as cd), and this machine has more than met my expectations! There are so many advanced features. The threading is way easier than my previous machine. (Dark ages model). You just need the patience to work through the work book step by step. It will guide you through the different stitches and functions in a logical sequence. I highly recommend this serger to advanced sewers.
customer_reviews.author: The Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine. Runs like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first Serger machine and so far I'm very happy with my purchase. A lot of reviews claimed that threading the machine is difficult. I can see how it can be difficult if you don't follow the workbook. The instruction manual is more of a reference guide whereas the workbook gives you a step by instruction on threading for each type of stitch. The package comes with a CD where you can print it out or view on your computer. There are also videos on YouTube where you can follow along and thread the machine. Its an awesome machine at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: NMSHNSN

customer_reviews.title: Poorly engineered buy a Juki 2000 best money I have spent!
customer_reviews.text: Junk sewed with sergers for years and this thing is junk would not see a stitch with out breaking thread
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: Wow, more than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for it's auto adjust tension. It's a little more harder to figure out the threading then my old 4 thread serger but once mastered I set it on the stretch mock safety stitch and it sews beautifully. So far tension is good. I plan on trying alot more settings. It's big and sturdy. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick Twin

customer_reviews.title: Great for experienced segers.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous serger. It sews like a dream. If you are experienced with threading a serger, it is great. However, it is not easy to switch between overlock and coverstitch.
customer_reviews.author: Jhewitt

customer_reviews.title: The Professional 5 is a versitile machine.
customer_reviews.text: The Professional 5 is a great machine because it can do a lot and is pretty easy to setup. I like how my projects have turned out and I didn't need to adjust from the auto tension very much while sewing knits.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t waste my money.
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with all things that were supposed to be included not to mention you have to get the manual to use on line with no videos at all. There are many others that are much easier to use and better quality.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Needs directions.
customer_reviews.text: High quality. Has a great selection of stitches. The quick reference booklet is horrible. It contradicts itself ll the time, nod the pictures don't match the description. The best course of action is to go on the singer website and download the ~200 page manual print it out and create a binder. The first time I threaded the machine, it took an hour. Now I can do it in about 10 min.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: manual poorly put together
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few months ago, and finally opened the box. the manual pages are misprinted, missing pages. it jumps from page 20 to 29, then 44 to 53. then it has extra pages 29-44. the pages that deal with how to thread the machine are missing.
customer_reviews.author: Edith H.

customer_reviews.title: Singer/ seller...I loved it
customer_reviews.text: Good machine excellent price. I will do a video to show...I did spent some time to learn but when i git the way....I loved. Need instructions book in portuguese.. I hope it comes fast to my countryBrasil because I will buy to my son. I will explain it fir him by video
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra traspadini

customer_reviews.title: Lots of threading issues
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a waste of money. Cannot go through 5minutes without the threading knotting or some threading issue. I called company to get help and the only help I received was that I would have to pay to get it fixed. This machine was not used frequently, it was used for about a week when problems started showing. Wish I had used it BEFORE amazon return timeline ended. But I didnt use it until months after purchasing so couldnt return. Very disappointed in this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: It's an excellent surger, but...
customer_reviews.text: ...there _is_ a fairly steep learning curve so if you're new to sergers and aren't mechanically-inclined, you're going to have an uphill battle learning the ins and outs of how this model works and how to work with it.
customer_reviews.author: A 21st Century Man

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have been sewing forever and have had several serger's but it was time to upgrade and I did a little research and decided on the singer as it was a great price and you can do so many things with it but it does take time to actually learn and master this machine so take your time and it will be a breeze and a dream to serge with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this serger/cover stitch machine
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this serger/cover stitch machine. LOVE it. I came from the Singer Stylist II and the learning curve here is much steeper, but it's worth it. SO worth it. Smooth, not too loud. Auto tension is perfect nearly every time. Super easy to adjust when it's not. A quick switch between modes (once you get used to and memorize the process, first time took a while, lol). The instruction manual is great and spells everything out for you.
customer_reviews.author: Laura H

customer_reviews.title: The patience when learning is well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a machine that did overlock, chain stitch and cover stitch. My singer 14T968D can do it all. I’ll have to admit, it took me some trial to learn how to correctly thread but once I did it and practice a few times, it’s a piece of cake. You’ve got to be patient though at first when learning. The stitches are even and strong and for the price, it’s a nice serger to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, great machine
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell so for this is a great machine. I am more or less a beginner at serging but the only problems that I have had with this machine were when I DIDN'T READ THE INSTRUCTIONS. Last weekend I made a dress using this machine only. No problems threading, no problems with tension. I can see myself using this a lot in the future. From what I can see this is a good price also. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: lmsdwarf

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: You can not beat this machine for the price if you’re wanting a cover stitch. My only issue is the tension does not stay put. So I use washi tape under the levers once I have it where I like it. Easy to remove and reposition when I need different tension settings. Of course it’s a pain to thread but anything with loopers is. I have pages in my manual marked as I have to reference it often when changing between cover stitch and serging or chain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think I would like it if it worked
customer_reviews.text: I think I would like it if it worked. Will not sew trying to get in touch with singer company to find out what I need to do
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a machine for beginners; it is a machine for experienced serger users
customer_reviews.text: Threading can be a problem unless you use uTube videos. The machine is a star and does so much more than most 5 thread machines for a lot less money.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Serger for me
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I ordered a Brother first and I sent it back. I wanted one with a cover stitch and I didn't notice in the description that the Brother did not have it. This one does and the instructions are easy to follow and once you thread it a couple of times its a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Serger!
customer_reviews.text: Once you take the time to learn how to thread the machine, everything else is easy. It just takes practice and patience. The workbook, that you download, is good for learn and the book that comes with the machine is good for quick reference. I still watched YouTube videos to make sure I was threading it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Taffney T. Petties

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: cant get the needle in to slot A. so most of the stitches are useless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best machine ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this machine!!! It was the best decision I have ever made. I'm saving up for a second machine. The Professional 5 would definitely be intimidating to new sewers, I've been sewing for 15+ years and it took a few tries to thread it, I can thread the machine in no time flat now.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: I have been sewing for 65 years and have never had a more difficult time with a machine.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a serger for many years. This one is the worst ever. If it wasn't too late to return this singer, I would. I am out a lot of money and unable to use this machine.
customer_reviews.author: maryritaryan

customer_reviews.title: Buy from Amazon. They have our back
customer_reviews.text: The tension was not adjustable after two weeks of use. And I had to send it back because nobody knew how to fix it. Broke my heart I loved the machine
customer_reviews.author: Diane M Tate

customer_reviews.title: Great Serger! Great Seller!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome item! I've been wanting a serger for a long time and have done a lot of research. This serger has all of the options and the seller was quick and included the extras she stated. The instructions are straight forward and threading the machine is the easiest I've ever seen. Great buy, great seller.
customer_reviews.author: SM Smith

customer_reviews.title: Singer 14T968DC Serger
customer_reviews.text: There is a learning curve but download the manual and stick with it well worth the time it gives you so many features for such a low price. I struggled with it in the beginning You Tube helped me a lot with the threading. You can hardly hear it serging, I've had it about six months and have used it for many projects.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Not as complicated as I thought
customer_reviews.text: I am new to sergers. I thought this one is complicated but figured it out easyish😜, and now having fun playing with and learning more and more..
customer_reviews.author: Lyne

customer_reviews.title: Best machine ever!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is an absolute dream come true, I was so nervous about getting it because of the the bad reviews it has gotten. I gotta say I tried the Brother 2340CV first and I was shocked about how toy-ish it felt! This one on the other hand, gives super professional finishes and the variety of stitches you can accomplish is AMAZING! It is better if you have some knowledge with sergers though, it can be tricky to thread at first but it’s NOT that complicated. You get two machines for the price of one and it almost feels semi-industrial. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Gaga

customer_reviews.title: Steep learning curve, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Like any decent serger, once you get the hang of it, it does its job superbly. I cannot think of any real criticism of this machine as compared to other machines like it: Steep learning curve. Lots of trial-and-error needed. But solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Impossible
customer_reviews.text: Omg. I brought a person to teach me who is a pro and she couldn’t figure it out !
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Hodes

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a serger before, but i really wanted to take my sewing to the next level. Very easy to use, and thread- just follow the workbook directions provided on the cd. May seem intimidating at first but it is honestly a very easy to use machine. Just have patience and follow the provided instructions. Easy to switch between overlook and coverstitch. If you are still experiencing difficulty there are many youtube videos available. Very satisfied with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected, I could never be more satisfied
customer_reviews.author: RockinRoxcin

customer_reviews.title: Make it clear in the description what the power source required is for the products sold.
customer_reviews.text: It was not clear when purchasing this product that it only operates on 110 v. I almost connected it to 220 v power supply and this could have had a disasterous outcomes. Lots of the electrical product bought in the USA works on both.
customer_reviews.author: Deonsmit

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy working with this machine. It is comfortable, strong and versatile. I have been using it as a 4 thread overclock on a very dusty felted material. It has met my expectations. I look forward to work on it yo create fashion wear next.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Ruggieor

customer_reviews.title: Machine that does both functions well
customer_reviews.text: Recipient loves it. Functions well both as serger and as coverstitch machine. Not difficult to change between modes. Loved the price we paid for a machine that does BOTH functions.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Hard to string for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Good serger but it's almost confusing to string. Noisy but overall once you get the knowledge of operating it should be a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Eilern Lowball

customer_reviews.title: Singer cover serger
customer_reviews.text: Never could get this machine going and Singer did not have a helping line so I sent it back
customer_reviews.author: Pamelia Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Read the manual first before using the machine.
customer_reviews.text: Had this machine before this a replacement, it’s an awesome machine to use. It’s fast and the stitches are beautiful once you set the tension correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia M.

customer_reviews.title: Experienced sewist needs this machine.
customer_reviews.text: This is not for beginners, however I have a 4 thread serger, so I can relate to this machine. Great quality for the money may purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: d. Swinton

customer_reviews.title: I love my new serger
customer_reviews.text: I love my new serger. But I wasn't aware that there was no manufacturer's warrenty when buying from the warehouse. Next time I'll read the fine print better. The tension levers don't move when I change the tension. I don't know if that's problem or not. The seger seems to work ok. I love the cover stitch. This is the reason I bought this serger.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sewing machine!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item! As described with perfect shipping! Thank you! Works wonderfully. Excellent quality sewing machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The name said it all. Professional in every respect ...
customer_reviews.text: The name said it all. Professional in every respect. Not a Toy and designed for the serious user with a high quality finish in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Raddatz

customer_reviews.title: Great serger!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the perfect stitches from the first! It is taking a new learning period to get the fabric just right for the cover stitch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Once I got the cover stich threaded it was amazing. Haven't tried other stitches yet keep playing with ...
customer_reviews.text: Found machine difficult to thread, had to go to Singer site to find. Once I got the cover stich threaded it was amazing. Haven't tried other stitches yet keep playing with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: beautiful machine but to much for someone who is not a professional seemstress
customer_reviews.text: was told I would get a refund still waiting to see the money back on my card. hopefully since they do have there machine back I will get it soon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is an amazing machine. I had a little difficulty threading it ...
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing machine. I had a little difficulty threading it at first but once I developed an understanding of how it is supposed to work, I had no problems with it. I especially like the automatic tension setting.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best serger ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love love!!! Having a swatch library is a great idea. Its a real pro machine. Would not recommend for beginners
customer_reviews.author: Danielaw

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great coverstitch/serger at a fantastic price. Couldn't beat the value any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: to help you look and make it easy
customer_reviews.text: very complex machine hard to understand you can not open the side.to help you look and make it easy
customer_reviews.author: Toni Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Singer Serger I
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to thread. I can’t answer the questions above
customer_reviews.author: Shaylor Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, sturdy machine at a fabulous price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine earlier this year and I have been extremely pleased. It's not a simple machine to use but I printed out the workbook from the CD and went through every activity in it, which took me about 2 days off and on. This allowed me to learn how to thread and convert from serging to coverstitch. I keep the printouts in a little binder by my machine. I primarily use this machine as a coverstitch (I already have a serger) and absolutely love it. I've used it on all sorts of garments, tops, pants, jackets. I would definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: This machine is very difficult to thread.
customer_reviews.text: Like the product but difficult to thread. Have to watch You Tube videos for help.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Beautiful professional hemming
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Beautiful professional hemming ! Just keep the manual so you can figure out all the different stitches and needle positions !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hard to thread
customer_reviews.text: This machine is possibly one of the hardest machines to thread it’s not a pleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: Menyelek rose

customer_reviews.title: Very good Serger with cover-stitch option.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent Serger, it will produce so many stitches and functions so well, just follow instructions for threading and it really helps to print out the workbook. Also I need to mention how well the auto-tension works for the stitch choices and how easy it is to fine tune them if needed. I feel this was a very good choice for me and it feels like it will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brettster3

customer_reviews.title: It's important to me for working in my business
customer_reviews.text: It's a great machine to have and use for my business
customer_reviews.author: JOANN HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: Need more information On how to thread The machine
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet. I can’t get it threaded. I am still working on it
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Nichols Washington

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the discounted price I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: Great machine for the discounted price I bought it for. 5 thread sergers are very hard to find for less than 1k.
customer_reviews.author: Tab

customer_reviews.title: Reserving judgment
customer_reviews.text: Used 2 days & foot pedal died 😖 Waiting for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita Axley

customer_reviews.title: Horrible cover stitch!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine as my first serger. I like the fact that it also did a cover Stitch. When in seger mode the machine works fine, I haven't had too many problems with it. Overall it has been a good first machine. But as a seamstress I have had nothing but trouble with the cover Stitch. The threads will come out of the needles and wrap themselves around the underside of the machine. Ruining hours of work to an almost finished product. This is an OK machine, but do not plan to do much cover stitching with it. It will ruin your work. Just but a separate machine specifically for cover stiches.
customer_reviews.author: Moab reader

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent machine. I'm very grateful to buy this amazing sew machine. The perfect tension and quality stitching.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Singer Serger
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice machine. It does much more than simply serge. I recommend this machine to anyone who likes to sew.
customer_reviews.author: Chiluvr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine. Read the reviews on the threading difficulty ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machine. Read the reviews on the threading difficulty so I expected that. The manual was minimally helpful in the process. However, found a video on Facebook that made it much easier to understand
customer_reviews.author: lavillian jordan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful machine. I love it. It does every task I could want in a serger.
customer_reviews.author: Pearlndigger

customer_reviews.title: Best machine ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love love my new serger I have yet to use the cover stitch but so far so good!! I Would totally recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: great machine @geonaribrooks
customer_reviews.text: It has all the features I need. .. You just have to be patient with this machine and it will become your best friend
customer_reviews.author: Gary petit Frere

customer_reviews.title: Other then that machine is as awesome
customer_reviews.text: Foot pedal didn't work once I recurred the item. Called singer waited 30min on hold. Been 2 weeks still no new pedal. Other then that machine is as awesome
customer_reviews.author: Caylee

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.  Machine is flimsy and unrepairable.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute crap. Was super excited to get this machine, threads up easily and got ONE garment finished when I broke a needle and now it won't chain. Local repair shop won't even take it because they say these are basically unrepairable. Complete waste of a LOT of money. One star, because I can't leave fewer.
customer_reviews.author: The Divine Iguana

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: This was the lowest I've ever seen this machine & had to jump on it. I've seen it sold as high as $1500.00 Bought it as a birthday present for myself. Set it up as soon as i received it. Wonderful product. It is not a machine for inexperienced sewers new to serging. The instruction manual shows how the thread and the exact needle position is key to great stitches. Would buy again! Great for doing couture finishes.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.M Designs

customer_reviews.title: So sad, I was looking forward to learning how to
customer_reviews.text: I am so frustrated. Very hard to thread and once I got it threaded the pressure foot doesn't provide power, hence so can't even see if it works!!! No one to contact for help either. So sad, I was looking forward to learning how to serge
customer_reviews.author: Tammy J Horvath

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with my serger. Amazon was very helpful any I received my machine faster than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: My machine is great,the only thing I had a problem with was threading the looper so I went on the Internet and found out how to do it through utube.
customer_reviews.author: Wyiona Howard

customer_reviews.title: Breaking thread issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this serger with great expectations, to my surprise it does not work. It jams and breaks the thread avery 2 inches of sewing. Tried to return it but can't. Will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Magdaleno L.

customer_reviews.title: Key to My Heart
customer_reviews.text: Perfection...yes threading may be difficult if you've never used one before. For me the most difficult part was realizing that I didn't have my needle completely secured and it was too low, so be sure to push it as far upward as you can and loosen the bolts you're not using and tighten them after you've tightened the one you need.
customer_reviews.author: Chaka Woods

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 5 thread serger, they are workhorses!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S.

customer_reviews.title: Does it all!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Works beautifully and smoothly. It is obviously complicated to learn how to use any serger/overlock or coverstitch machine so it is going to be a little complicated for anyone who isn't already familiar with these types of machines. But for anyone who is already familiar with these machines, it is an awesome machine that does it all. I advise that if this is the first time using a serger or coverstitch, that you take a lesson at your local sewing store.
customer_reviews.author: Angela P Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This machine works like a dream. It did take some getting used to to figure out how to change the settings because I have not used a five thread serger before, but the manual was extremely useful. It also came in a timely manner. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly advanced serger
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Singer serger before this one for almost 20 years but a part broke off that could not be fixed , so I decided to get a new one. These machines are very reliable. I'm a seamstress so I use it a lot. I was surprised to see how advanced this model is. It has functions ten times more than the regular sergers. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I have owned a thread serger for 30 years which made this less intimidating straight out of the box. The hem roll is beautiful
customer_reviews.author: brb

customer_reviews.title: It works nicely, the automatic wire tensioning is not completely flawless
customer_reviews.text: It works nicely, the automatic wire tensioning is not completely flawless, but it works way easier than my old serger. Only downside for me is in the looks, the broken white/light yellow color makes it look like a product from 20 years ago. Especially next two my computerized singer sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: SINGER | Professional 14T968DC Serger Overlock with 2-3-4-5 Stitch Capability, 1300 Stitches per minute, & Self Adjusting - Sewing Made Easy,White
product_meta.description:
The SINGER Professional 5 14T968DC Serger machine has 2-3-4-5 thread capability providing a wide selection of stitch options for all types of projects with professional results every time. It saves time because it sews a seam, seam finish, and trims excess allowance all at once – 3 steps in 1. Creative stitch options and fabric combinations can expand your creativity.

The SINGER Professional 5 14T968DC Serger sews at 1,300 stitches per minute while trimming and overcasting, you will zip through projects in no time. Decorative flatlock and easy rolled hems add a finishing touch to garments, home décor projects and more. An adjustable cutting width, stitch length control, self-adjusting tension system and color-coded threading allow for creative freedom and easy set-up!

Achieve an expert to your projects using the SINGER Professional 5 14T968DC Serger. It has 2-3-4-5 thread capability, providing a wide selection of sewing options for all types of projects. Other features include an adjustable cutting width, stitch length control, an automatic, self-adjusting tension system and color-coded threading. This 5-thread serger offers easy setup and comes with numerous accessories.





PRODUCT DETAILS:

Model: 14T968DC
Brand: SINGER
Manufacturer Part Number: 14T968DC
Type: Sergers
Assembled Product Weight: 23.55 pounds
Product Dimension (L x W x H): 13.50 x 10.30 x 11.00 Inches
Light Bulb: 120V 15Watt
Needles: SINGER Style 2022
MPN: AZ59C37250B7680
EAN: 910139588723
UPC: 102930991400

Do not pull or push fabric while stitching. It may deflect the needles causing them to break. High Speed Stitching (1300/min)
feature_bullets: SINGER PROFESSIONAL SEWING MACHINE: The SINGER 14T968DC Serger machine has 2-3-4-5 thread capability providing a wide selection of stitch options for all types of projects with professional results every time.
SEWING SPEED: The SINGER Professional 5 14T968DC serger has a maximum sewing speed of 1,300 stitches-per-minute, so projects can be sewn quickly.

4 BUILT-IN ROLLED HEMS: The SINGER Professional 14T968DC 5 sewing machine converting to the Rolled Hem sewing mode is effortless. An easy access lever moves the stitch finger in position for rolled hemming.
BEST SEWING MACHINE: The SINGER Professional 5 14T968DC serger has a wide range of stitch options for sewing seams, hems, decorative edges, rolled hems, cover hems, and more..Amps : 0.5
This sewing machine is warranted for use in the US and Canada at 110 volts only. Note: To ensure proper stitching, it is important to keep tension while threading the machine.

Limited 90-DAY Warranty for Adjustments, Belts, Rings, Bulbs, Attachments; Limited 2-Year Warranty for Motors, Light assembly, Wiring, Switches,Speed control and Electronic Components; Limited 25-Year Warranty for Sewing Machine Head
SELF-ADJUSTING TENSION: The SINGER 14T968DC Serger has a self-adjusting tension system. Simply turn a dial to select the chart, and the tension settings for that stitch are adjusted automatically.
